strategies¶

base¶

This module provides the Strategy base class.

It is used as the parent class for custom strategy classes, which are to be used either by the BacktestEngine or the ForwardEngine.

class Strategy[source]¶

Bases: ABC

The class used as parent for custom strategy classes.

__init__(symbols: str | list[str], capital: float | list[float], stop_rule: dict, profit_rule: dict, interval: str = '1m', window: int = 30, date_rules: list[dict] | None = None, event_rules: list[dict] | None = None, vol_rules: list[dict] | None = None, timeout: str = None) → None[source]¶

Initialises the Strategy class.

Parameters:

  • symbols (str | list[str]) – The symbols involved in the strategy

  • capital (float | list[float]) – The capital to be invested in each trade resulting from the strategy

  • stop_rule (dict) – The dictionary necessary to instantiate a StopRule object; this provides a stop-loss price level

  • profit_rule (dict) – The dictionary necessary to instantiate a ProfitRule object; this provides a take-profit price level

  • interval (str, optional) – The time interval between consecutive bars (‘m’ for minute, ‘h’ for hour, ‘d’ for day, ‘mo’ for month, ‘y’ for year), by default ‘1m’

  • window (int, optional) – The length of the buffer filled with historic data necessary for signal generation (in units of intervals), by default 30

  • date_rules (list[dict] | None, optional) – The list of dictionaries from which a list of DatetimeRule object will be created; these provide trading restrictions based on dates/times, by default None

  • event_rules (list[dict] | None, optional) – The list of dictionaries from which a list of EventRule objects will be created; these provide trading restrictions based on macro events, by default None

  • vol_rules (list[dict] | None, optional) – The list of dictionaries from which a list of VolumeRule objects will be created; these provide trading restrictions based on traded volumes, by default None

  • timeout (str, optional) – The timeout to be used per trade (‘m’ for minute, ‘h’ for hour, ‘d’ for day, ‘mo’ for month, ‘y’ for year), by default None (i.e. runs until interrupted)

property capital¶
property interval¶
abstractmethod on_bar(ts: Timestamp, bar: Series, history: DataFrame) → DataFrame[source]¶

Checks if a signal should be emitted based on current bar.

Parameters:

  • ts (pd.Timestamp) – The time stamp of the current bar

  • bar (pd.Series) – The current bar containing price data (OHLC) and volume

  • history (pd.DataFrame) – The historic data used to compute relevant indicators

Returns:

The signal emitted by the strategy; it contains the following:

  • symbols: the list of symbols involved in the strategy

  • trade_type: +1/-1 for long/short trade

  • capital: the capital to be invested in the trade

  • entry_ts: the entry time of the trade

  • timeout: the time the trade is allowed to be active before closing

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

property symbols¶
to_state() → dict[source]¶

Serialises a Strategy object to a dictionary.

This is used for checkpointing during engine runs.

Returns:

The dictionary containing all attributes of the current state of the Strategy object

Return type:

dict

property window¶

factory¶

This module provides a registry for custom Strategy subclasses.

It holds strategy classes whose parent class is Strategy. New custom classes Class are added to the registry by appending ``add_strategy(path.to.module, Class).

add_strategy(name: str, cls: Strategy) → None[source]¶

This function adds a custom class to the registry.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The path to the custom module containing the class

  • cls (Strategy) – The custom class (subclass of Strategy)

get_strategy(name: str) → Strategy[source]¶

This function retrieves a custom class from the registry. If it’s not registered yet, it adds it.

Parameters:

name (str) – The path to the custom module containing the class

Returns:

The custom class from the registry

Return type:

Strategy

Raises:

ModuleNotFoundError – if the module from which the custom class should be imported can’t be found

load_strategy(cfg: dict) → Strategy[source]¶

This function instantiates the Strategy class.

Here, the dictionary contains all attributes of the class, not just init parameters. This function is used when recovering an object whose state was previously saved as a dictionary.

Parameters:

cfg (dict) – The dictionary containing all attributes of the object

Returns:

The class object resulting from instatiating Strategy with the given set of attributes

Return type:

Strategy

make_strategy(cfg: dict) → Strategy[source]¶

This function instatiates the Strategy class.

This function is used when creating a Strategy object fresh, i.e. the dictionary only contains init parameters. The remaining attributes are set after initialisation.

Parameters:

cfg (dict) – The dictionary containing init parameters for the class

Returns:

The class object resulting from instatiating Strategy with the given set of init parameters

Return type:

Strategy

rm_strategy(name: str) → None[source]¶

This function removes a strategy from the registry.

Parameters:

name (str) – The path to the module containing the class

show_strategy_names() → list[str][source]¶

This function prints a list of all classes currently contained in the registry.

Returns:

The list of names of classes contained in the registry

Return type:

list[str]
